The axe that had been sticking out of it earlier is now m The telephone RINGS.  Eyes riveted to the crate, Debra ba down the hall.  Into the living room.  Picks up the phone

dialogues.speaker: DEBRA
dialogues.text: Hello? A startling, intensely whispering VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We want the child ... Debra slams down the phone.  Terror paralyzing her. MUFFLED, HEAVY BREATHING fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: DEBRA
dialogues.text: Oh, God ... Debra races back into the foyer and struggles with the do panic, she can't release the chain lock. She turns to see the Shape standing right behind her!  De SCREAMS.  Breaks for the hall.  Through the kitchen.  Fli the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debra half-runs, half-stumbles through the endless rows o clotheslines.  White sheets twist around her like ghosts blustering WIND.  She tosses them aside, one after the ot Approaching the driveway.  Safety up ahead. Whipping aside the last sheet, Debra finds herself starin Shape's death mask.  Her eyes bug.  Too late to scream. axe swings at her like a sledge hammer.  Blood paints the as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laden with her book bag, Kara exits the library and heads campus green.  All around her, the sights and sounds of t impending carnival come to life. Rides assembled.  Paper witches hang from broomsticks.  G behind syrofoam gravestones. Kara waves at Beth in the distance, making last-minute  preparations.  Student volunteers scurrying in every whic direction.  Donning costumes. A ducking for apples booth.  Homebaked goodies set out on tables.  Long rows of pumpkins lined up for a jack-o'-lan carving contest. The centerpiece of all this is a huge, magnificently deco HALLOWEEN TREE.  Tim and a gaggle of WORKERS stream up la stringing lights, hoisting up colorful bunting filled wit candy. As Kara walks along, her hair being tossed about in the b she becomes aware of the magical, almost out of time qual seems to hang in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara walks past the crows of "Harry-ites" gathered outsid campus gates, now extending half-way around the block. The WKNB van rolls by, exhorting the crowd with the voice they've all come to see:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY SIMMS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's almost that time, all you kiddies and  women with big -- hey, what rhymes with  kiddies?  So let's count it down as we get down  to the witching hour! Kara walks on, smiling to herself as the crowd bursts int wild, exuberant CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The setting sun glows behind the trees, casting long shad rounds the corner onto her street. KIDS already pouring out of their homes, some accompanied PARENTS, others joining groups of friends. Kara ambles up the walk of the Myers house, shoes clappin porch steps as she digs the keys out of her overstuffed b Unbolting the door, she finds that it's secured with the  chain-lock.  Kara pushes on it, calling inside.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm home ... Hello? No response.  Puzzled, she steps off the porch and makes around the side of the house, CAMERA FOLLOWING as she pee windows along the way.

dialogues.speaker: BACK YARD, (CONTINUOUS)
dialogues.text: Kara walks along the billowing clotheslines, passing the where the blood-stained sheets were -- and are no longer. She reaches the back door.  Standing ajar.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Mom? Casting one last glance across the yard, she steps inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything in its proper place.  Kara drops her heavy bag kitchen table and proceeds down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM / FOYER
dialogues.text: The room is quickly falling into darkness.  The eeriness palpable.  Kara advances into the living room, eyes roami

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Mom? ... Danny? Nothing.  Kara moves into the foyer.  Her mother's suitca sitting there.  Beyond, the cellar door stands wide open. moves toward it, peering into blackness. A sudden CRASH from upstairs.  Kara jerks the door closed up the deeply-shadowed staircase.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mom?  Are you there? A muffled ROAR.  Kara mounts the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY, (CONTINUOUS)
dialogues.text: Kara reaches the second floor landing and moves slowly to door at the end of the hall.  Danny's room.  An orange gl around the edges of the closed door. KARA'S P.O.V. Her hand grabs the doorknob, turns it.  The door swings o

dialogues.speaker: DANNY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Someone sitting on the edge of Danny's bed.  A man.  His turned.  Dinosaurs ROAR on Sega Genesis.  Danny squatting floor, engrossed in his game. Kara stares at the intruder in horrified disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? The man watching over Danny turns toward Kara.  It's Tomm

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I-I'm your neighbor from across the street.  My  name's Tommy.  Tommy Doyle. Panicked, Kara makes a wall of herself between Tommy and little boy isn't the least bit fazed.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: What are you doing with my son? Where's my  mother? Tommy backs off a tick, calmly trying to explain.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: She wasn't here when I brought Danny home  from --

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (fortissimo) Danny, go downstairs -- Now! Danny finally looks up, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Tommy's my new friend.  We've been playing 'til  you got home.  He knows all about dinosaurs. One look at Danny's black eye and Kara goes ballistic.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: My, God!  What have you done to him?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I didn't -- He got in a fight and I --

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You stay away from him! Kara starts to drag Danny away by the arm.  He resists an

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It wasn't Tommy!  It was the voice man. Kara sees Tommy hunkering down in the corner, lifting som of a crate -- a makeship crib.  He turns, his expression grave.  Holding the baby.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I want you to listen very carefully to  everything I'm about to tell you. Kara's face is a melange of wonder and fear as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie lies comatose, ensconced in the dim GLOW of monitor Sustained by I.V.s and a breathing apparatus. MOVE IN on Jamie.  EKG registers rapid heartbeat.  MOVE I her eyes, darting beneath closed lids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood-chilling SCREAMS as we MOVE rapidly through a BLIND OF LIGHT.  Blurred, indistinct images.  FIGURES wearing l coats flash along sterile walls. As we BLAST around corners, we realize we are seeing from of a girl being pushed forward on a gurney.  It is Jamie. Her arm injected with a sedative.  Eyes lolling.  Succumb

dialogues.speaker: MOVING, (DREAM SEQUENCE)
dialogues.text: Even more DISTORTED now, images swirling at random.  Cold FACES.  Flashing lights on a wall panel:  "3-2-1-B" -- an Going down.  Down.  Beneath the basement level. The doors open.  The gurney SLAMS out into DARKNESS.  VOI Lighted torches flicker on craggy walls.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Please -- don't let him do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We're not going to hurt you, Jamie.  He chose  you.  Now it's time. SHAPE'S P.O.V. Pacing back and forth behind iron bars, agitated, disturb Jamie strapped to a table.  Surrounded by robed figures. Weakly, Jamie reaches out toward the cell.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Please, Michael ... Help me. Suddenly a long SHADOW fills the room.  The P.O.V. become restless as the Stranger glides toward Jamie and disrobes figures close the circle.  Jamie SCREAMS in terror. The Shape's hands SLAM violently against the iron bars, a SHUDDER of metal as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie's eyes flash open!  A dark shadow fills the room. Stranger descends on her! Gloved hand covers Jamie's mouth.  A switchblade FLICKS o

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your work is done, Jamie. The glinting blade SLASHES across Jamie's throat, cutting soundless scream! Then the Stranger flows out of the room.  Spurs CLANKING. thief in the night.  The shrill sound of a BEEPER going o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark blanket of night envelops the little town.  The the fair twinkle in the distance, bright and beckoning. Families -- men, women and children alike -- turn out fro homes wearing COSTUMES, joining a growing procession alon peaceful streets of Haddonfield. A large group of PROTESTORS carry PICKET SIGNS in front o campus gates.  Rallying against the celebration. Haddonfield's finest out in full force, squad cars sweepi alongside a black STRETCH LIMO as it makes its way throug Tinted windows make it impossible to see inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Beth, standouts as punk versions of Frankenstein bride, stride purposefully toward the fair entrance.  Bet jumble of nerves as she runs down her checklist of events

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty is the costume pageant ... Carving  jack-o'-lanterns at eight ... Photos for the  school paper at nine ... Then Harry lights the  tree at nine- thirty ... I just know I'm  forgetting something!

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Relax.  Everything's cool.  Didn't I tell you  Harry would be here? The limo crawls into the parking lot.  A stampede of over FANS surge past them.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That's what worries me. Tim and Beth move into the fair, with all its noise and c movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIDS waving signs and T-shirts.  Throwing themselves at t windows.  Frenzied CLAMORING.  Harry-mania abound. The WKNB van parks parallel to the steps of the library, with HAREM GIRLS and a large golden throne.  The side doo red carpet is rolled out. A tall, imposing figure emerges from the van and walks up steps.  Spurs CLANKING on black boots.  "Jesse James" sty Hat cocked slightly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY SIMMS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hellllo, Haddonfield!!! The crowd turns in a mass of confusion.  Standing above t from a microphone, is HARRY.  Dark sunglasses.  Gaunt, gl features and an outrageous mane of black hair. Suddenly Harry throws open his duster -- flashing them -- that he has nothing on beneath except his boots and a pai orange boxer shorts that say "HAPPY HALLOWEEN." The kids go insane.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Making his way through the teeming crowd.  Walkie-talkie The helicopter zooms overhead.  Wynn's voice squawks over RADIO CHATTER.  Conducting a surveillance by air.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) There's more people moving eastbound down Old  Reservoir Road past the elementary school.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Any word on the location of the Strodes?

dialogues.speaker: WYNN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one's home.  Checked it out myself.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Good.  I want around-the-clock surveillance on  that house. Suddenly Loomis is waylaid by a giant wall of a man -- Sh Holdt.  Loomis meets his fiery gaze.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDT
dialogues.text: I'm warning you, Loomis -- stay out of my way.   You may have had free reign when Ben Meeker was  sheriff, God rest his soul, but I'm in charge  now.  And I'm not about to stand by and watch  you turn this night into some kind of sadistic  witch hunt.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sam, I just got word from the hospital. You'd  better get over there right away.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) What's wrong?  What's happened to Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: WYNN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'll meet you over there. Loomis tears off.  Holdt stares brazenly, throwing down h cigarette.  Crushes it under his boot and slowly follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the CRYING baby, Tommy leads Kara and Danny into of the vintage boarding home.  Polished wood.  Framed old paintings.  Wall-to-wall Tiffany lamps. Mrs. Blankenship sits behind the front desk, oblivious to GRINDING and SCREAMING on the television as "The Texas Ch Massacre" reaches its horrific climax on the annual Horro

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Quiet around here tonight, huh, Mrs. B.? As usual, the senile old woman doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (indignantly; to Tommy) Do you mind telling me what this is all about?   Tim and Beth are waiting for us. Tommy ushers Kara and Danny up the stairs.  Mrs. Blankens at the boy -- the kind of stare that would send most kids for their moms.  But Danny is undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.  Kara is repulsed by the sight of Tommy's unkempt apartment.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mom, I want to go to the fair ...

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) You can't expect us to stay here -- Tommy adjusts the blinds on the window looking out on the house.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I want you to watch your house.  You can see  everything from this window. Kara glares, reminded of last night.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Do you know how insane this is?  Who am I  supposed to be looking for?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Him. Tommy flashes a newspaper article in front of her.  One w eariler:  "MICHAEL MYERS - DEAD OF ALIVE?" The baby's SCREAMS are verging on overload.  Tommy dashes recessed kitchen area and heats up another bottle. As Kara reads, Danny tugs at his mother's blouse.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Come on, Mom.  We're gonna miss all the fun  stuff!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (snapping) Danny, you're just going to have to wait! Danny plods off.  Kara hands Tommy a nipple for the bottl eyes lock for a beat.  He takes it.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Shhh.  It's okay, Kyle.  Just give me one  more --  (the microwave BEEPS) -- second.  There you go, big guy. Kara looks on as Tommy attempts to feed the baby.  Despit clumsiness, she's undeniably moved. Behind them, Danny's imagination kicks into high gear as Power Ranger over an invisible race track.  On the floor. the windowsill.  Glancing across the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE MYERS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Standing below on the front lawn is the Shape, silhouette moonlit tree.  Looking right at Danny.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Danny backs away, terrified.  Tommy and Kara are too conc the baby to notice.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: God, what's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Here.  Let me try. Tommy gingerly hands the baby over to her.  Instantaneous CRIES subside.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (continuing; fawning) There.  All it takes is a mother's touch. For one fleeting moment, Tommy and Kara find themselves s one another.  Unaware as Danny glides silently out the do Tommy's expression darkens once again.  A man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Kyle's mother might be dead for all I know.   Now I'm afraid he could be next.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Why would anyone want to kill an innocent baby?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Not just Kyle.  All of you.  His entire family.  (reaching toward Kyle) Here.  Look at this. Tommy opens the baby's quilt, revealing the blood mark sm his torso.  Kara's face registers terrified recognition.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (continuing) It was there when I found him this morning.  It  looks like some kind of letter or number or --

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It's a rune ... Thorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE on the scene.  A crying NURSE gives a statement. SCENE PHOTOGRAPHER snapps photographs as Jamie's bloody c covered over with a white sheet. Loomis stands frozen in horror.  Tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Jamie ... I failed you again.  I never should  have left you. He spins, pouncing on Sheriff Holdt.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now will you do something?!  How many more  innocent people have to die?! Wynn restrains him.  Pulls him away.  The sheriff doesn't

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: Don't do this to yourself, Sam.  Let's go.   Come on. Wynn ushers Loomis out of the room.  Holdt stares apathet

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY, (CONTINUOUS)
dialogues.text: Wynn tries to calm Loomis down.  Jamie's doctor approache

dialogues.speaker: DR. BONHAM
dialogues.text: Dr. Loomis?

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DR. BONHAM
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry ...

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You let it get to her.  How could you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. BONHAM
dialogues.text: Dr. Loomis, there's something else you should  know.  During surgery, we discovered that  Jamie's uterus was hemorrhaging.  We found  this.  (displays a small vital) It's placental fluid.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: God in heaven.  You don't tell me she was --

dialogues.speaker: DR. BONHAM
dialogues.text: I estimate she gave birth no more than a few  hours before the attack.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: Then where's her baby? Jamie's covered body is wheeled out past them.  Loomis re with a look of abject fear.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I think I may already know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a chapter heading.  "Thorn - The Devil's Rune." it, a bold depiction of the familiar Thorn triangle. PULL BACK to REVEAL Tommy poring over the old library boo paces, rocking the baby, feeding him with the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Runes were a kind of early alphabet that  originated in Northern Europe thousands of  years ago.  They were symbols -- carved out of  stone or pieces of wood.  Of all the runes,  Thorn had the most negative influence. Cults  used them in blood rituals to portend future  events and invoke magic.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Black magic ...  (reads) 'In ancient times, Thorn was believed to cause  sickness, famine and death. Translated  literally, it was the name of a demon spirit  that delivered human sacrifices ... on the  Celtic celebration of Samhain.'

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: 'When applied directly to another person, Thorn  could be used to call upon them confusion and  destruction -- to literally visit them with the  Devil.' Tommy jumps up, frantically moving around the apartment, his jacket, his keys -- a gun.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (terrified) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: To find the rest of your family before Michael  Myers does -- or whoever's been controlling  him. An ominous CLICK as Tommy loads a cartridge into his gun. toward the door.  Finds it standing wide open.  Kara free noticing for the first time that Danny is missing.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- Where's Danny? Kara flies down the  hall, the baby in her arms.  Tommy moves out  right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara and Tommy barrel downstairs, searching frantically.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny?!  Danny!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blankenship, have you seen the little boy  who came in with me and -- They find Mrs. Blankenship and Danny sitting side by side the Horrorthon.  A bowl of popcorn between them.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (grabs him) Danny, don't ever walk off without telling me  where you're going! Danny looks at her.  A blank, hollow stare.  The old woma glitter madly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLANKENSHIP
dialogues.text: The voice.  He hears the voice.  Just like the  other little boy who used to live in that  house. Tommy throws on his jacket and opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Take the kids upstairs, lock the door and wait  for me.  (beat) And Kara, whatever you do -- don't go back to  your house. Kara watches fearfully as Tommy heads out the door.  Leav alone with the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind MOANS.  Dead leaves blow across the WINDY lane as To down the path of the Blankenship house and hops into his The Shape suddenly RISES INTO FRAME.  Watching him peel o block.  Taillights disappearing. A moment later, another car rambles up the street, swervi erratically into the driveway of the Myers house. The Shape watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car parks.  Sits in silence.  Suddenly the driver's s opens, emblazoned with the "Strode Realty" emblem. John spills out, collar unbuttoned, tie dangling.  Pickin up, he staggers out of the garage.  Laughing.  Singing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: ... Pretty woman, walking down the street ...  Pretty woman, the kind I'd like to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW John's circuitous route across the front lawn, stu one of Danny's toys on his way up the porch steps.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Damn kid ... this is my house ... John fumbles wth his key, estimates the location of the l turns the knob -- but the door's jammed.  Chain-locked.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the fuck ...  (yelling inside) ... Debra, open this goddamn door before I  break it down!  You got to three ...  (no response) ... One ... Two ...  (still no response) ... Two and a half ... John slams his weight against the door.  It doesn't budge Grumbling, John totters off the porch, trying to hold him steady.  Skirting along the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sways in through the back door and flicks on a light for lucidity.  No one in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Debra -- I'm home! No answer.  John shrugs and moves to the stove.  Opens th pasta cooker.  Nothing inside.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (continuing; mutters) Work all day and not even any supper ... Frustrated, John opens the freezer and removes a frozen d Tears open the box and pops it in the microwave.  Then he down the dark alley, knocking picture frames awry.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM / FOYER
dialogues.text: Darkness, save for a glowing jack-o'-lantern.  John stand listing.  Bewildered. Then he switches on a lamp, kicks off his shoes and crash lumpy old recliner.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: All right ... You can all come out now ... Still no reply.  John sneers, flicks on the television wi remote control and settles back into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION
dialogues.text: A scene from another horror movie.  A boy shreds his pump a mass of beetles and snakes pour out of his skull.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What is this shit? Disgusted, he switches channels to the local NEWS.  A shr from the kitchen startles him.  The microwave.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: John waddles to a drawer and removes a set of utensils. reaches for the microwave, opens it.  But his dinner is g Spinning around, he sees the piping hot entree already si on the kitchen table.  John double-takes, mentally retrac steps.  Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW JOHN
dialogues.text: as he picks up his tray and plods back down the hall.  Su trips over something -- the suitcase Debra had packed ear sitting smack-dead in the center of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So this is the game you wanna play. Fine.  Go  ahead.  Keep it up all night ...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: John settles back into his chair and begins to eat raveno SCREAMS from the television.  He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION
dialogues.text: Someone has switched it back to the horror movie.  A  COMPUTER-GENERATED PUMPKIN causes more masked heads to EX

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: John shakes the remote.  Out of the corner of his eye, he shadowy figure darting by in the darkened foyer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Is that you, you little brat?  Danny?! John rises, about to go for him when suddenly the power c and the entire house is plunged into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (continuing) When I get my hands on you, kid, you're gonna  wish you were never born! John pulls a rechargeable flashlight from the wall and go cellar door.  It stands open.  An invitation to enter.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, I'm scared.  I'm really scared. With that, John steps down into the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tentatively descends the stairs.  Barefoot.  The fla beam preceding his every step.  A RUMBLING below. The cellar is lit only by a shaft of moonlight cutting th single dusty window.  John probes around, shining the fla over cobwebs, boxes -- the puddle of water at his feet. flooding the entire floor. John SLOSHES through the water toward the washing machine is running at full tact.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell -- He opens the washer lid and lifts out a water-logged shee drips red onto the white appliance -- blood. John backs away, loses his footing, and slips in the wate landing right at the Shape's feet.  John SCREAMS as the S him by the neck, lifts him off the floor with one hand, t him across the basement and SLAMS him brutally against th box. The Shape's free hand lifts an enormous butcher knife.  A as it's driven to the hilt into John's chest, through the Sparks wain from the wall.  Electricity courses through J writing body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flash on and off in the windows.  Suddenly the ent is plunged into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's toes curl.  The skin around where the knife penetr FRIES.  The Shape steps back, head tilted, BREATHING stea curiously observing John's hanging, lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy grabs the ticket he's just paid for, hands it to an and moves through the turnstiles amid a steady stream of Loud MUSIC, the aroma of apple cider and pumpkin pie fill Boots selling food and crafts.  Children carving jack-o'- Parents beaming with pride. Trendy co-eds playing games.  Ducking for apples.  Shooti pumpkin-faced balloons with water pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Beth sit on either side of Harry as he interviews during a live BROADCAST.  A large crowd gathered below.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm here with Tim and Beth -- the organizers of  tonight's event.  How does it feel knowing  you've finally pulled Halloween out of the  closet?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yo, Harry, it's great!  And having you here  with us is dope.  Totally raw. You're the  ultimate juice!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
dialogues.text: I'll remember that the next time my wife tells  me I didn't make her climax.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (impassioned) What Tim means is that we've taken a firm stand  against censorship.  Not only for Haddonfield,  but for every town in the nation.  Our  generation will not let the powers-that-be  control our minds, dictate what clothes we  wear, what music we listen to, or what holidays  we celebrate. Beth's rousing speech is met by gales of enthusiastic CHE

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (off-handedly) Have you ever considered running for public  office?

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The distant SOUNDS of the celebration are carried on the the WIND.  Howling through dark, empty streets.  Rows of houses.  Not a soul in sight.  Preternatural stillness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara looks nervously out a window, then walks into the pa she finds Danny sitting in the dark, glued to the Horrort Flames CRACKLE in the fireplace, casting weird shadows. Mrs. Blankenship sits in a wooden rocker, cradling the in humming a lullaby. If we look closely enough, behind her in the window we ca hazy shadow of the Shape looking in.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blankenship, what did you mean about the  little boy who used to live across the street? The old woman doesn't seem to hear her.  Lost in her own

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (continuing; insistent) Mrs. Blankenship, please.  This is important! Mrs. Blankenship looks up sharply, startling Kara.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLANKENSHIP
dialogues.text: He heard the voice.  Same as your boy hears.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: What voice?  What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLANKENSHIP
dialogues.text: The voice that spoke to Michael Myers. The one  that told him to kill his family. Kara stares at her, numbed.  She gazes over at Danny, his riveted  -- not to the TV screen.  Looking past it.  Acro street at the Myers house.  The haunting VOICE whispers t

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm coming for you, Danny ... I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Beth ride high atop the Ferris wheel.  Their smil aglow in a dizzying whirlwind of LIGHTS.  DARK CLOUDS are in the sky, covering the moon and stars.  A light RAIN be fall.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Walking, searching, hunting.  Past a large tent where chi gathering.  A sign reads:  COSTUME PAGEANT. Tommy reacts to a terrified SCREAM.  Just a couple of tee pulling an innocuously fightened GIRL onto another ride.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRANGER
dialogues.text: walks steadily past the bright lights of the Ferris wheel

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: pushes through a dense crowd.  Suddenly he bumps shoulder Stranger.  More people pass.  There was something very si about that man. Tommy turns to look again, eyes widening in terror.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER'S WRIST
dialogues.text: Branded with the mark of Thorn!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: removes his gun.  Flows through the crowd like a vengeful People see the gun in his hand and back away.  Tommy surg forward.  The Stranger walks faster.  Gaining ground.  To Halloween tree. WORKERS hauling wheelbarrows loaded with jack-o'-lanterns path.  Tommy stumbles, pumpkins spilling out all around h The Stranger is getting away!  Tommy picks himself up, ra gun and begins FIRING shots into the air.  People SCREAM, like insects, ducking for cover.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Stop that man!  Stop him!!! Tommy races through the horrified crowd.  The Stranger ke never once looking back. Suddenly SIRENS.  Squad cars converge.  Sheriff Holdt and OFFICERS surround Tommy.  Weapons trained.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDT
dialogues.text: Throw down the gun!  Now!!! Tommy drops the gun.  Puts his arms up in surrender.  The in, taking him.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Stop that man!  He's the one!

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS WHEEL
dialogues.text: Beth and Tim exit the ride and follow the crowd toward th LIGHTS of the police cruisers.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Who's gettin' busted? Beth is stunned to see Tommy being searched spread-eagle sheriff's car.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jesus, that's my neighbor.  Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Isn't he that psycho who's been spying on my  sister?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (worried) Kara and Danny never showed up tonight. We'd  better go home and check on them. There's  nothing else for us to do here.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: But they're gonna light the tree in a few  minutes --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (suggestively) We can light our own tree at home. She brushes against Tim's crotch and saunters away.  Tim back at Tommy, then follows her like a hungry puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara rushes Danny and the baby inside.  The old spinster her heels.  Releasing her dark secret.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLANKENSHIP
dialogues.text: I was baby-sitting for him that night. Little  Mikey Myers from across the street.  That's  when the voice told him what to do.  Same as  his great- grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: His what?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLANKENSHIP
dialogues.text: Eighteen-ninety-five.  A hundred years ago to  this night.  All Hallows Eve. Murdered his  family in that very same house.  Then the  townspeople burned him alive.  Our mother  always told us when we were children, 'Don't go  near the Myers house.'  We never did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stranger glides unnoticed among a large crowd gathere lighting of the Halloween tree.  People putting up umbrel STORM fast approaching. Hundreds of anxious kids stand beneath the oak tree with and pillow cases, waiting for the candy to drop on them.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING P.O.V
dialogues.text: MOVING behind the tree where a long-haired figure stands darkness.  Waiting to make a presentation.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: turns, sensing a presence.  A knife shoots out of the dar jabbing him right between the legs.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: is shoved into the back of the squad car.  Suddenly Loomi Prevailing upon the sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Wait!  This boy is being placed in my custody. Tommy looks out, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDT
dialogues.text: What are you trying to pull now, Loomis?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Uncuff him!  This is a matter of life or death.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The knife is lifted straight up, splitting his torso in t bugging with shock.  He slumps to the ground in a huge po blood.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY AND LOOMIS
dialogues.text: The sheriff uncuffs Tommy and shoves him out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDT
dialogues.text: You'd better as fuck have an explanation for  this, Doctor. Loomis begins to usher Tommy through the gaping crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Dr. Loomis, there's something you should  know -- Tommy is prodded forward by Loomis's .357.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I know enough already.  Just shut your mouth  and take me to that baby. They move swiftly through the gaping crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: A growing murmur of concern spreads.  "Where's Harry?"  T becoming impatient, and the impending STORM isn't doing m anyone's nerves.  Harry's people are at a loss to explain whereabouts.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS AND TOMMY
dialogues.text: On the fringes of the crowd.  Walking away. "Oohs" and "ahhs" as the tree suddenly comes to life with orange lights.  From the boughs of the tree, ropes are pu tears open, dropping hails of CANDY on the SHRIEKING kids Tommy glances back.  His eyes drawn to something.  Grotes tree.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God --

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: Kids of all ages scurry around the stage, laughing and sc rainbow of candy RAINS down on them.  Diving for it.  Fig Scooping it up in big handfuls.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY AND LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tommy instantly breaks away and tears back through the cr

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tommy! Loomis goes for him.  Sheriff Holdt sees what is happenin flies toward them in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: TREE
dialogues.text: A BALLERINA looks down at her white pillow case in horrif astonishment.  Her hands painted red as she reaches insid of her candy is covered with blood! The other kids back away in revulsion -- the entire stage to drip with blood! The adults don't seem to notice what is happening, more c with the sudden burst of POURING RAIN. Tommy pushes his way through the crowd, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Get them out of there!  Get out!!! Sheriff Holdt tries to intercept Tommy just as he leaps u the stage, pushing kids out of the way. Parents' faces register shock when they see their childre toward them, SCREAMING hysterically, soaked with blood. Loomis sees what Tommy sees.  Words cannot convey the hor eyes. Just then, a BOLT OF LIGHTNING ignites the tree.  SPARKS Tiny pumpkin lights EXPLODE in a startling chain reaction Tommy helps the last of the kids off the stage when somet from the gnarled branches:  a dangling, rotating, wrapped The mutilated remains of Harry Simms! Horrified, Tommy dashes headlong off the stage.  Runs wit with the trampling crowd. Struck dumb with terror, Holdt looks out upon the mass de The bloody corpse hanging from the tree.  People running, carrying their children toward the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumper to bumper cars.  Horns BLARING.  Women SCREAMING. Children CRYING.  Pandemonium. Loomis and Tommy appear out of this jumble of confusion. running along the sidewalks.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- Kara!!! A car SCREECHES to a halt as Tommy barrels across the str right behind him.  Running toward home. Once again, terror reigns in Haddonfield, Illinois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara shivers as she curls up beside Danny on the futon, h sleeping baby close at her bosom.  THUNDER rattles the ol

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mommy, I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be scared of, baby. It's just another  storm.  Try to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I can't.  The voice man is coming to get me.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No one's coming to get you.  Not while I'm around.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (kisses him) I promise. Kara stands up and goes to the window, looking out into t pouring RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: THE MYERS HOUSE
dialogues.text: Dark and foreboding.  LIGHTNING FLASHES.  Beth's car park front.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: She stares at the car, puzzled.  Quickly she moves away f window, heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: She KNOCKS loudly on the door across the hall.  A sign th "Beth's Place."

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Beth, are you in there? She knocks again.  No response.  Another CLAP OF THUNDER. shudders, quickly returns to Tommy's apartment and locks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of PASSION as we FOLLOW a trail of hastily-discard pieces across the darkened foyer.  Tim and Beth are on th half-naked, kissing fervently.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (coming up for air) Guess they -- went to the fair after all.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: (hot and heavy) Guess so ... Tim nuzzles his face in Beth's chest.  She's feeling appr

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What if your parents come home?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Then they can watch. Laughing, they heard up the stairs, kissing, fondling eac Slowly we PULL BACK into the foyer.  THUNDER and LIGHTNIN revealing the Shape, knife held at ready.  Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the cordless phone, switches on and dials he number.  We HEAR the phone RINGING on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth collapses with Tim onto Kara's bed.  The PHONE RINGS ignores it, consumed by passion.  Beth sits up nervously.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna answer that?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Answer what?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (fends him off) What if it's Kara? Frustrated, Tim jumps off the bed and stomps into the bat taking a candle with him.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Fine.  You answer it.  I'll make friends with my soap on rope. Tim slams the door.  Beth deliberates her move, then goes up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara is frantic.  Looking out the window at the Myers hou

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mom -- Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kara? ... No, this is Beth.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: What are you doing there?  Where's my mother?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We were worried about you guys so we left early to see if you were --

dialogues.speaker: KARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is Tim there?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: He's in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: A lighted candle flickers.  Tim waits for the running sho warm up as he does a bare-ass jig over to the sink. Rinsing off his tooth brush, he elbows out a circle of st the mirror.  He gasps.  The Shape is standing right behin Before he can react, Tim's head is yanked backwards.  The SNAP of his neck is punctuated by a CRASH OF THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara can SEE Beth on the phone.  Sitting by the window.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I'm across the street.  I can see you. Beth, I want you t listen to me.  Get Tim and get out of that house.  Right  now. Unnoticed by Kara, Danny rises and crosses the room.  Dra the door by the irascible voice.

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come to me, Danny ... Come to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth shifts nervously, looking out across the way at Kara THUNDER drowns out the sound of the bathroom door CREAKIN Shape advances.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Kara, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara's mouth suddenly drops open.  Her mind snaps into se She can see the Shape walking up behind Beth!  Raising a butcher knife!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Beth, look out!  There's someone in the room!  He's right behind you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth drops the phone, eyes bulging as the Shape plunges t into her back.  She falls, CRASHING against the vanity. Beth SCREAMS unholy terror.  But the Shape isn't through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara stands frozen in pure horror, hearing and seeing her vicious murder. Her eyes shoot down.  A little blond-haired boy is walkin across the street toward the Myers house. No, it can't be true.  Kara wheels around.  Danny is gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny can be seen below walking toward the house as Beth' blood-gurgling SCREAMS fill the room.  The knife repeated mercilessly SLASHING down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara bolts out of the Blankenship house and races across chasing after Danny through RAIN and LIGHTNING.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny, no!!!

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING DANNY
dialogues.text: He glides up the porch steps and slips through the front Myers house.  Disappearing inside.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: shoots across the lawn.  Up the porch steps.  Right behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara dives through the front door.  THUNDER shatters the Everything is frighteningly dark.  Shockingly quiet. Inch by inch, she makes her way inside.  Eyes wide.  Sava Shaking uncontrollably.  A CRASHING SOUND behind her.  Sh of her skin.  Just the door SLAMMING shut in the WIND.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (the faintest whisper) Danny? She advances into the hall.  Old floorboards CREAK beneat SOUNDS up ahead.  FOOTSTEPS. Kara looks up.  LIGHTNING FLASHES.  Danny is nearing the stairs! Instinct propels her up the stairs after him.  Then sudde dead.  Reason taking over.  And she turns back. Picks up a fireplace poker sitting in the corner.  Then s up the stairs.  Mind-blown with horror.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Kara reaches the top of the staircase, looking down the d Summoning all of her courage, she moves forward. Suddenly Danny darts out from the adjacent hall and disap his bedroom -- a fleeting, ghostly image.  Kara startles. inside.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Danny stands in a corner.  LIGHTNING illuminates his toy Kara goes to him, takes his hand.  He resists her.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (intense whisper) Come on ... Danny, please. She picks him up, carries him toward the door.  LUMBERING Kara stands paralyzed in the doorway as the Shape stalks Eyes probing.  Walking right past them.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Kara slips silently back into the room, carrying Danny th bathroom.  Adjoining on the opposite side into

dialogues.speaker: KARA'S ROOM
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING CRACKLES.  The walls are covered with blood.  K over something on the floor.  Cranes her neck to look dow Beth's bloody, mangled remains at her feet. Shock waves send Kara reeling backwards against the open Hanging on a hook is Tim's naked body, eyes open, staring horrified rictus of death. Kara SCREAMS.  Drops Danny.  Quickly covers her mouth.  R she's given them away. Suddenly the bedroom door tears open, buckling off its hi Shape bulldozes in, wielding its huge butcher knife!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny, run!!! Danny ducks into the hall, evading the Shape's lurching h

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: careens down the stairs.  THUNDER RAGES.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: brandishes the fireplace poker at the killer.  The Shape backing her through the bathroom ... into Danny's room. she SLAMS the door on the Shape. Kara tears off into the hallway.  Turns.  Waiting for the appear.  It doesn't. Kara vacillates down the hall.  Jumping at every sound. weapon at things unseen.  SLAMMING doors along the way, s every passageway as she tries to find her way through the dark tunnel. Suddenly something CRASHES down from above.  Kara's mothe a bloody sheet, dangling upside-down from the trap door i The axe still protruding from her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara SCREAMS, shrinking away from the gruesome sight, fal the blackened doorway behind her.  An unbearable moment o think the Shape's mask will be there. Suddenly the Shape shoots up directly in front of her!  T dangling corpse from the sheet, dislodging the axe from D with a repulsive SQUISH. Kara wheels toward the stairs.  The Shape advances.  Swin Misses her by inches.  Kara ducks, lurches behind the Sha the fireplace poker with everything she's got.  CRACKING over the back of the Shape's head. The Shape breaks through the banister and plunges off the SLAMMING hard onto the floor below. Terrified, Kara chances a look down.  The Shape doesn't m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's Explorer skids to a stop outside the boarding hou Tommy fly up the front path.  Tommy glances back at the b house for a moment, then follows Loomis inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara barrels off the stairs.  Moves cautiously past the S face-up in the middle of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Kara searches for Danny, keeping her eyes trained on the little boy appears in the doorway directly across the hal The Shape lying in between them.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny, come to Mommy. Danny shakes his head.  Too frightened to move.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY / FOYER
dialogues.text: Ever so slowly, Kara moves toward the threshold.  Hefting poker, she steps right over the Shape. Instantly she snatches Danny up in her arms.  Takes one s suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mommy!!! The Shape springs up, twisting Kara's ankle.  She falls, The Shape claws at her leg.  Kara fights back, kicking he vice-like grip. Scrambling to her feet, Kara rockets Danny through the fo door -- desperately trying to escape from this real-life -- only to find that it is locked. The Shape rises, gleaming butcher knife in hand. Kara twists the deadbolt, but someone's secured the chain to remove it.  The Shape is right behind them. Only one way to go.  The cellar.  Kara shoves Danny throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara and Danny clatter down the rickety stairs and SPLASH basement floor. A soul-shuddering POUNDING on the door above. Kara ushers Danny toward the elevated window. The cellar door EXPLODES, the Shape's hand breaking throu the wood as if it were paper. Kara HEARS the Shape moving rapidly down the stairs.  Lif wall toward the window.  But it's not a wall -- it's John body, propped inside a storage cabinet! Danny SHRIEKS, staring into John's lifeless eyes.  Kara p Danny reaches for the lock.  Just an inch away. Kara can't lift him any higher.  The Shape is coming! Danny hoists himself up just enough to twist the lock.  H window open and clambers outside. Kara scrambles up old pressboard shelves.  They break und she topples back to the floor. The Shape wades toward her.  Reaching up for the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny watches his mother struggle to climb out of the cry

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny, help me! Kara's hand reaches toward him.  Danny makes no movement.

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERING VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come to me, Danny ... Come to me. Danny obediently turns and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara's foot falls on the handle of the knife jutting from chest.  Uses it to springboard herself half-way through t Clawing at wet grass. The Shape's hand shoots out of the darkness below, grabbi Kara writhes, kicking and SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara grabs chunks of mud as she is pulled back through th Shape yanks hard.  Kara catches herself on the window fra losing her grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife swipes downward, swiping her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara reacts to the searing pain, releasing her grip on th Suddenly Danny appears, locking onto her collar, pulling massive heave. Kara shuffles across the ground and picks herself up.  Gr and runs full-tilt around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS their frenzied flight across the street. Explorer.  Kara limping.  Danny surging toward the Blanke SCREAMS, pounding frantically on the door.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Please!  Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Loomis have turned the apartment upside-down.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: The baby -- where's the baby?! Suddenly they HEAR Kara's frantic pleas outside.  Tommy b Loomis right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara POUNDS furiously.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Please!  Somebody help us! Danny huddles beside her, peering out across the street.

dialogues.speaker: MYERS HOUSE
dialogues.text: The Shape trudges boldly down the porch steps -- knife in

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kara sees the Shape -- walking slowly and deliberately to SCREAMS become even more intense.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Help us please!!! The Shape closes in.  At the last second, Tommy throws op and Danny tumble inside.  Into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis slams and deadbolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Get them upstairs.  Now! Kara pounds against Tommy's chest.  Hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Where's the baby?!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: He's gone. Kara holds Danny close to her side, backing away in horro Loomis go around the parlor, securing the doors and windo through the darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Who else knew I had the baby?!

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No -- there had to be someone else. Who knew?!

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Only me --  (dark realization) -- and Dr. Wynn. Suddenly the window behind Kara EXPLODES.  She SCREAMS, r the window in front of her.  HANDS reach through.  Tommy the way. ANOTHER HAND shoots through the stained glass window in t twists open the lock. Danny races across the lobby and up the stairs. Robed figures fill the doorways.  Climbing through window the house.  Surrounding Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wynn!!! The robed figures descend on Loomis.  Drops his .357.  To to no avail.  Loomis's SCREAM fills the darkness like a f

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Run, Tommy!!!  Run!!!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No!!! Tommy backpedals up the stairs.  Kara pulling him along a figures glow toward them.  Daggers raised.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Kara reacts to the SOUND of Danny's VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mommy!  Please help me! Kara rushes through darkness to find him.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny!  Danny, where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Kara, no! Kara trips and falls.  A pair of silver-tipped black boot bold stance.  Slowly she looks up the long duster, the ci gloved hand of the nefarious Stranger -- Dr. Wynn!  Danny side, staring dispassionately.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Danny, no ... please ... Kara picks herself up, shaking her head in unmitigated fe back down the hallway. She turns to see the black figures overtaking Tommy.  His swallowed by hollow darkness. Alone, Kara careens through another doorway into

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Kara slams the door, turns in desperate circles. Stepping out from behind the door is Mrs. Blankenship -- in her arms!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Mrs. Blankenship -- Oh, God -- Hurry. We have to -- As Kara reaches for the baby, the old woman raises a dagg burning.  Her wrist branded with the mark of Thorn! Kara SCREAMS.  The old woman opens the door, allowing the enter the room.  Daggers drawn.  CHANTING a dark invocati The coven forces Kara backwards.  Nowhere to run.  Nowher Suddenly Kara makes a decision -- and takes a running lea window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defenestrating herself, Kara SCREAMS, tumbling through th off the porch overhang before plunging to the front lawn thousand grass fragments raining down on her.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: lies on her back, eyes close, hands folded over her chest repose.  She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: is still.  Unearthly silence fills the cold October night

dialogues.speaker: DISTORTED
dialogues.text: A ring of faceless figures move in, completely surroundin Suddenly the feeling of RAPID MOVEMENT.  Glowing torchlig across dank walls.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: is being pushed forward on a gurney.  Strapped down.  SCR mercy.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: is wheeled through another tunnel.  His face a mass of bl bruises.  His eyes glazed over, trying to find focus.  SL darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING illuminates the cold, forbidding asylum.  The w to the security gate.  Headlights illuminate the sign:  "

dialogues.speaker: WARREN COUNTY SANITARIUM."
dialogues.text: The main gate cranks open.  The van pulls through.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: pulls to a stop near the main building.  The door slides steps out, surrounded by Smith's Grove staff wearing whit Leading him toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: LANDING FIELD
dialogues.text: The helicopter touches down.  Wynn ducks out, moving in l toward the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Wynn through the series of security cages, using h BUZZ through.  White coats bringing up the rear. Through tall mahogany doors, they cross purposefully into

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Dawn, Wynn's efficient secretary, rises with a congenial

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Good evening, Dr. Wynn.  Your -- appointment is waiting  inside. Wynn picks up his messages, then heads straight into the resumes her typing.  Something eerie in her grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wynn and his staff file inside.  Removing his hat and dus to where Loomis is seated -- shackled to a chair, a blood his forehead. Seeing this, Wynn snaps angrily at two burly GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: What is this all about?  Remove those! The guards comply.  Loomis rubs his aching wrists, glower

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Where's the child?

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: Sam, you know you never fail to amaze me.  Yesterday  happily retired, today right back in the thick of things. Somehow I knew you still had it in you. Loomis sees his .357 resting atop Wynn's desk -- only inc hand covers it, slips it inside the top drawer.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come now, Sam.  This is a gathering of old friends.  I kn how difficult this must be for you -- a man of your  upbringing and integrity -- but now that I'm in charge I  felt it was only fair that you finally know the truth.  (gestures to his staff) After all, you're the only one around here who's still in the dark, as it were.  This isn't the way I wanted to tel you, but you've really given me no other choice.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: This is madness, Wynn.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: Your madness is another man's greatness.  This is the way things have always been.  You've just been too blinded by your own reality to see.  (beat) But having you on the outside has been convenient for us many ways.  (smiles) You always did come through -- our loyal watch dog.   Finding him. Bringing him back to us once he'd finished h work.  Although after you had that nasty stroke the last  time, I had to go after him myself.  And what a terrible  time we had getting him out of that jail cell.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It was you.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: (lights a cigarette) Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why did you take Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: She has the gift -- the blood of Thorn running through he veins.  Michael's mother had it, too.  So for six years I incubated her, prepared her for this night.  Michael has  served his purpose.  And soon we will have a new progeny.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Jamie's baby ...

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: There you go trying to make sense again.  (grimly entranced) It's a curse.  Handed down through countless generations. As ageless as this celebration which you call Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Samhain.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: And I'm its deliverer.  (slams his key card on the desk) Its calling card, if you will.  I follow it.  Protect it. Act as its guardian.  In a sense, Sam, so do you. Loomis shudders, rocked by these revelations.

dialogues.speaker: WYNN
dialogues.text: (continuing) I know you have more questions, my friend, and there's so much more for you to try to make sense of. Loomis is hoisted out of his chair and led out of the off his white coats flow out behind him.
